column4: so am i being shunned from the ubuntu community, because my question wasn't easy to answer.  I'm part of the way there.  why is my computer problem less valid than other peoples? if you can't answer my computer trouble just say so.
http://paste.ubuntu.com/461799
i've made things worse by following instructions from here.  the terminal at least used to try to download.
it used to go to 98% and fail.  but now it won't even start
That's because you've got another one open.  Please pastebin the output of `ps aux`
Can you please make your terminal larger and do it again?  Things got cropped off and it's making it difficult to identify
ps aux, again
That's the same.  See how the right side gets cut off mid commmand at the bottom?  Lets do this instead, `ps aux > ~/running.txt` and then open ~/running.txt and copy/paste it.
i copied you command you told me "ps aux > ~/running.txt" and it didn't seem to do anything
It didn't give any output, but what it did was create a text file called running.txt in your homedir, open that file and then copy/paste the contents of it
Are you only in the terminal?
GUI would probably be easier for you.  Just find the file (places > home) and double click it.
Perfect, thanks.
alright, do you still get the error from `sudo apt-get update`?
What version of Ubuntu are you on?
`lsb_release -a` will tell you
http://paste.ubuntu.com/461824/
That'll work for your sources.list

i already replaced the text in sources.list to what now works for at least updating.  the list to copy was sent by another user and there was way more text than that.  should i add these ones or leave my, now working repositories as is.
If you've already got somethign working, then don't worry about it.
back when people were telling me to run 'sudo apt-get update' they were also telling me to type in a second command too.  do you have any idea what that may have been?  another part of the update?
After updating, `sudo apt-get dist-upgrade` would work
what does sudo apt-get dist-upgrade do
It'll upgrade all of your software to the latest versions in the repositories
